string_table.string: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip Navigation. Hit enter to return to the slide.

slidelink.displaytext: Interview Questions: What Can I Ask?
Illegal vs. Legal: Are you a US citizen?
Illegal vs. Legal: How many sick days did you take last year?
Illegal vs. Legal: What are your child care arrangements?
Illegal vs. Legal: This job requires fluency in Spanish. Are you fluent?
Illegal vs. Legal: Your first project will last about 18 months. Are you planning to take any maternity leave in the next two years?
Illegal vs. Legal: This job requires you to be able to lift 25 pounds from one area to another. Are you able to do that with or without reasonable accommodation?
Illegal vs. Legal: Do you belong to a club or social organization? We like our salespeople to play golf with our clients.
Illegal vs. Legal: Are you in good health?
Illegal vs. Legal: From your resume, it appears you are very active in your church. Would it be a problem for you to work on Sundays?
Illegal vs. Legal: This job requires you to locate. Is your wife okay with that?

resource_data.description: Here are some useful links and documents:

terms.term: Behavioral interviewing is based on the assumption that past behavior is the best predictor of future behavior (e.g., "Describe a stressful situation at work and how you handled it.").

The EEOC is an indepdendent federal agency that promotes equal opportunity in employment through administrative and judicial enforcement of the federal civil rights laws and through education and technical assistance.
